glosses: on an empty stomach, without having eaten

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish آج قارننه (ac ḳarnına), from آج (ac, aç) and قارن (ḳarn, ḳarın), equivalent to aç (“hungry”) + karın (“stomach”) + -ı (possessive suffix) + -(n)a (dative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant), literally “on/with hungry stomach”. Cognates with Azerbaijani acqarına, Bashkir ас ҡарынға (as qarınğa), Kazakh ашқарынға (aşqarynğa), Kyrgyz ач карынга (ac karınga), Tatar ач карынга (aç qarınğa), Uzbek och qoringa.
